Share Tease Of First Single “Learn To Live”, Reveal Lineup Apr 18th, 2017 - 11:59am 0 
Bad Wolves have confirmed their full lineup and shared a taste of their upcoming music video for their first single, “ Learn To Live “, which will arrive on May 01st. Former DevilDriver drummer John Boecklin was the early driving force (no pun intended) behind the project, tracking their debut effort at Audio Hammer Studios with Mark Lewis ( Trivium , DevilDriver ). He said of the group: 
“We sound like a heavy-slightly prog rock band that tunes low and cuts off most of the fat. Watching Faith No More on the reunion tour made my thought process change. I was standing there, and it hit me that I don’t want to be in a metal band with screaming all the time. We’re heavy, yet from track-to-track, things change quite a bit.” 
Vocalist Tommy Vext added: 
“More was revealed, so more was required. The overall tonality and approach resonated with me as an opportunity to challenge myself and grow as a vocalist. I was given a platform to tap into some musical influences I hadn’t yet explored in previous bands. All in all, it was some of the most diverse, original material I’ve gotten to wrap my hands around.” 
The band’s full lineup includes: 
Vocals – Tommy Vext ( Westfield Massacre , ex- Divine Heresy , etc.) Guitars – Doc Coyle ( Vagus Nerve , ex- God Forbid ) Guitars – Chris Cain (ex- Bury Your Dead ) Bass – Kyle Konkiel ( VIMIC , ex- In This Moment ) Drums – John Boecklin (ex- DevilDriver )
